intro: Eleotis anchietae, commonly known as the Anchieta's loach, is a freshwater fish species native to the rivers of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyprinidae and is characterized by its elongated body and distinctive coloration. The plant associated with this species, though not a true plant, is often found in its habitat, such as aquatic vegetation that provides shelter and breeding grounds. Eleotis anchietae plays a role in maintaining the ecological balance of its environment by feeding on algae and small invertebrates. Its presence is an indicator of the health of freshwater ecosystems in its native range.
